# C++ Qt API client

# 

Authentiq Connect API

- API version: 1.0
- Generator version: 7.9.0

Authentiq Connect OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect API reference.
Learn about [Authentiq ID](https://www.authentiq.com/) or check out the [Authentiq Connect](https://developers.authentiq.com) developer documentation.


  For more information, please visit [https://www.authentiq.com/](https://www.authentiq.com/)

*Automatically generated by the [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:

1. CMake 3.2+
2. Qt
3. C++ Compiler

## Getting Started

example.h:
```c++

#include <iostream>
#include "../client/OAIAuthenticationApi.h"

using namespace test_namespace;

class Example : public QObject {
    Q_OBJECT
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    QString create();
    qint32 create();
    QString create();
public Q_SLOTS:
   void exampleFunction1();
};

```

example.cpp:
```c++

#include "../client/OAIAuthenticationApi.h"
#include "example.h"
#include <QTimer>
#include <QEventLoop>

QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
qint32 Example::create(){
    qint32 obj;
QString Example::create(){
    QString obj;
 return obj;
}

void Example::exampleFunction1(){
     OAIAuthenticationApi apiInstance;
     
      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString client_id = create(); // QString | A client ID obtained from the [Dashboard](https://dashboard.authentiq.com/).

          loop.quit();
      });

          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString response_type = create(); // QString | The OIDC response type to use for this authentication flow. Valid choices are `code`, `id_token`, `token`, `token id_token`, `code id_token` `code token` and `code token id_token`, but a client can be configured with a more restricted set. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString scope = create(); // QString | The space-separated identity claims to request from the end-user. Always include `openid` as a scope for compatibility with OIDC. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();

      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString redirect_uri = create(); // QString | The location to redirect to after (un)successful authentication. Unless the client is in test-mode this must be one of the registered redirect URLs. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString state = create(); // QString | An opaque string that will be passed back to the redirect URL and therefore can be used to communicate client side state and prevent CSRF attacks. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString response_mode = create(); // QString | Whether to append parameters to the redirect URL in the query string (`query`) or as fragments (`fragment`). This option usually has a sensible default for each of the response types. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString nonce = create(); // QString | An nonce provided by the client (and opaque to Authentiq Connect) that will be included in any ID Token generated for this session. Clients should use the nonce to mitigate replay attacks. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString display = create(); // QString | The authentication display mode, which can be one of `page`, `popup` or `modal`. Defaults to `page`. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString prompt = create(); // QString | Space-delimited, case sensitive list of ASCII string values that specifies whether the Authorization Server prompts the End-User for reauthentication and consent. The supported values are: `none`, `login`, `consent`. If `consent` the end-user is asked to (re)confirm what claims they share. Use `none` to check for an active session. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      qint32 max_age = create(); // qint32 | Specifies the allowable elapsed time in seconds since the last time the end-user was actively authenticated. 

      QEventLoop loop;
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignal, [&]() {
          loop.quit();
      });
      connect(&apiInstance, &OAIAuthenticationApi::authorizeSignalE, [&](QNetworkReply::NetworkError, QString error_str) {
          qDebug() << "Error happened while issuing request : " << error_str;
          loop.quit();
      });

      QString ui_locales = create(); // QString | Specifies the preferred language to use on the authorization page, as a space-separated list of BCP47 language tags. Ignored at the moment. 
      apiInstance.authorize(client_idresponse_typescoperedirect_uristateresponse_modenoncedisplaypromptmax_ageui_locales);
      QTimer::singleShot(5000, &loop, &QEventLoop::quit);
      loop.exec();
  }

```

## Documentation for Servers

Parameterized Servers are supported. Define a server in the API for each endpoint with arbitrary numbers of variables:

```yaml
servers:
- url: http://{server}:{port}/{basePath}
  description: Description of the Server
  variables:
    server:
        enum:
          - 'petstore'
          - 'qa-petstore'
          - 'dev-petstore'
        default: 'petstore'
    port:
      enum:
        - '3000'
        - '1000'
      default: '3000'
    basePath:
      default: v1
```
To change the default variable, use this function in each Api:
```c++
int setDefaultServerValue(int serverIndex,const QString &operation, const QString &variable,const QString &val);
```
The parameter "serverIndex" will choose a server from the server list for each endpoint. There is always at least one server with index 0. The Parameter "operation" should be the desired endpoint operationid.
Variable is the name of the variable you wish to change and the value is the new default Value.
The function will return -1 when the variable does not exists, -2 if value is not defined in the variable enum and -3 if the operation is not found.

If your endpoint has multiple server objects in the servers array, you can set the server that will be used with this function:
```c++
void setServerIndex(const QString &operation, int serverIndex);
```
Parameter "operation" should be your operationid. "serverIndex" is the index you want to set as your default server. The function will check if there is a server with your index.
Here is an example of multiple servers in the servers array. The first server will have index 0 and the second will have index 1.
```yaml
servers:
- url: http://{server}:8080/
  description: Description of the Server
  variables:
    server:
        enum:
          - 'petstore'
          - 'qa-petstore'
          - 'dev-petstore'
        default: 'petstore'
- url: https://localhost:8080/v1
```

## Documentation for Authorization

Authentication schemes defined for the API:
### client_registration_token


- **Type**: API key
- **API key parameter name**: Authorization
- **Location**: HTTP header

### client_secret


- **Type**: OAuth
- **Flow**: password
- **Authorization URL**: 
- **Scopes**: 
  - clients: Enable client management

### oauth_code


- **Type**: OAuth
- **Flow**: accessCode
- **Authorization URL**: https://connect.authentiq.io/authorize
- **Scopes**: 
  - address: The user&#39;s postal address
  - aq:location: The user&#39;s current location
  - aq:name: The user&#39;s full name
  - aq:push: Enable *One click sign-in*
  - email: The user&#39;s email address
  - oidc: Enable OIDC flow
  - phone: The user&#39;s phone number

### oauth_implicit


- **Type**: OAuth
- **Flow**: implicit
- **Authorization URL**: https://connect.authentiq.io/authorize
- **Scopes**: 
  - address: The user&#39;s postal address
  - aq:location: The user&#39;s current location
  - aq:name: The user&#39;s full name
  - aq:push: Enable *One click sign-in*
  - email: The user&#39;s email address
  - oidc: Enable OIDC flow
  - phone: The user&#39;s phone number

### user_jwt


- **Type**: OAuth
- **Flow**: application
- **Authorization URL**: 
- **Scopes**: 
  - session: Enable session management
